ratings.comment: So the material wasn't too hard but since he assumes everyone already know many things people don't do well in his class. He skips the basics and go deep into things he is not supposed to teach (more advanced topics that he likes better), then in the exam he asks about the basics that he didn't teach.
Good guy. Material is straightforward, as is his delivery. Very honest and has his own little humor. If you don't like his class its because you don't like econ.

Navarro is the worst, homework is ridiculous, tests are all his bs math and nothing from book or lecture. stay away from this professor. he does not care about students. he assigned homework due sunday over thanksgiving break

Class is pretty hard, curves are nice but you better hope you get a good TA cause most are pretty bad.  Also if you're easily offended watch out, he will drop **** comments throughout the semester. My favorite was that AIDS was the best thing to happen to Africa productivity wise
Navarro is the man! Exams are a bit tricky but if you put the time in, you can definitely do well.

I know a lot of people hated him. I thought he was really funny, but still hardly got me to lecture. He uses the online program called "aplia" for homework. He usually gives an automatic 20 point curve on tests. If you don't hate econ, there is no reason you should hate this class.

homework is helpful, does teach in steps but the tests are ridiculously hard. lectures are useless, discussions are def helpful. final is worth a lot (40%) but is impossible but there is a generous curve.

He is really not as bad as everyone says! He consistently gives clear and engaging lectures. Topics are not exciting.. but it's a theory class. Homework is done online and usually took me a LONG time, but it really helps you learn the material in steps. The tests are pretty hard and you WILL run out of time. The curve is very generous though.

Probably the worst professor I have had.  I started the semester off by going to every lecture and stopped when I realized 1) how useless they were -- GO TO DISCUSSION INSTEAD! and 2) how insulting he is.  He makes off topic comments that are completely incorrect, judgmental, and rude.  Exams are hard but the curve is generous.
Kinda a mean teacher, but knowledgable

This guy is a really good econ professor. If you go to class and pay some attention it is easy to do well. Compared to other profs in the econ department, he gives relatively easy exams also. I thought 101 was more difficult with Carranza.

Navarro is the man. People say that his lecture is unbearable and not helpful at all, but I went to his office hours often and he was very helpful even though he was very busy. Take this guy, its challenging but worth.

terrible teacher.  Never covered material that was on test in class. Moved his office hours simply because too many students wanted help on the homework and he didnt feel like helping.  go to discussion

By far the most awful professor I ever had. I like econ, but his lectures are just unbearable. Literally reads off the powerpoint which is a mirror image of the textbook. Problem sets are impossible to solve only with what he had covered in lecture, but they do help a lot when it comes to test preparation. Go to discussion sections, not lectures.

Out of everyone I know who has had him, only a handful like him as much as I did.  His preparation for class is amazing and always knows what he is talking about.  Sure the tests are hard, but he's the kind of teacher that demmands a lot from his students.  So, if you work hard you'll do well.

Awful. Completely awful professor.  Made us buy a $130 textbook and then never used it.  Didn't tell us until class what chapters the lecture would be based on, so no way to prepare.  Really confusing, flipped through slides too fast to copy anything down, especially all the math.  Couldn't even read through them all the way.  Ridiculous curve, I g

Do a good job on the homeworks, they count for a lot. Read the book and go over the problem set problems to review for the exams. He doesn't put up with any whiny, pc, or stupid people's crap, which can be quite amusing at times. He's really not as aweful as some of these ratings would have you believe. The curve for exams is AMAZING!!

Obviously a tough class, as it is the first intermediate level economics class designed to weed out the serious economics students from the slackers, but this prof does not present the material very clearly.  I didn't have the book and did poorly on homeworks, but still got a B with the really lenient curve.  Do homeworks thoroughly & study graphs.

He lectures fairly quickly, so it can be difficult to keep up sometimes. Tests are very hard, but the curve makes up for that.  The homework assignments were long and difficult as well.  Even though the course was difficult, I learned a lot from the lectures and would probably take a class with him again because of the fairness of the curve.

Really a poor professor. I've seen much better in Madison econ department; there is no reason why anyone needs to put up with a prof like this. Pompous, condescending, and unhelpful. Do your best to avoid this one.

This is the worst teacher I've had in my life, and there's no one in close 2nd. Sure, he is smart, good for him. Not all smart people are arrogant and pompus ****s though. Doesn't like his job, not very helpful, and doesn't like his students. He needs an office job working for the Treasury Dept. where he can be isolated from all social functions

I'd definitely take another class with him.  His lectures are very helpful, and although some people don't like his style, I like how he doesn't put up with any BS.  Exams were fair and not too bad with proper preparation

He doesn't care about teaching, and it shows.  The only information I learned that was helpful in this class was in discussion section.  If you can avoid it, do not take a class with this guy... if you can't avoid it, switch majors.
run away, run FAR away if you see this prof teaching your class. We can only hope that he'll never be teaching again. Since he hates it anyways.

He can definitely be a d-bag, and that can be very annoying.  However, I think he does an excellent job lecturing on the topics, and he does a good job building from previous lectures. I feel that this is one of few classes where putting time into the material really will pay off, and failing to do so will get people whining about how he's a jerk.

This guy hasn't spent a day doing anything in the real world and that is extremely evident in his teaching style. I understand that it's an intermediate class level, but sometimes apples and oranges convey the message better than x's and y's. He's a terrible teacher and a cocky ****, the real world didn't want him so he's trying teaching. Beware
Yes, he's a hardcore Chicago graduate, but he really knows his****, and he spells it out very clearly.  The tests are hard, but they're decently curved.  A hard class but not really an unfair one.
Hates his job.  Has no interest in teaching.  "I won't lose any sleep over failing anyone..." because "I don't know any of you, when I look out at you, all I see is a sea of faces."
